ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this class to both archaeology and anthropology students.

This is a great class for anyone who is interested in craft specialization or the development of ancient civilization. I would recommend it to others. It covers different regions and periods. This class also introduces different theories of craft specialization. It displays the development of the research on craft specialization.
I would recommend this class for all archaeollgy students.

A must-attend for anyone studying archaeology since craft production and specialization is a topic that pretty much every student will come across. This provides a great introduction to virtually every material used in craft production and provides readings that everyone should be familiar with. Definitely a great course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The topic of craft specialization is foundational for all archaeologists and thus applicable to furthering graduate studies.

My major is history, and I am interested in material culture.Thanks to this class, I have gained a deep understanding of the meaning of the objects that I look at. This class helps me understand the production organizations and distribution systems behind the excavated objects. The theories introduced in class also gives me a lot of inspirations.
This course exposed me to many useful approaches to craft specialization which have greatly conributed to my development as a scholar.
This course will be critical in preparing me both for my dissertation and for future field work. It greatly contributed to my understanding of the topic.
